comments:
I am fairly new to Eclipse so I hope this is a real problem that will be solved 
soon.
I have the latest Eclipse and the latest JRE with all the latest updates.
I then decided I liked the thought of having a visual editor and went to the 
plugin download section and installed VE, EMF and GEFS. 
It seemed to install.  I had to restart eclipse.  
Then I tried to create a simple project and a simple Visual class.
Errors.   Several errors.  Unfortuneately I did not capture the error text 
exactly.  I thought it had something to do with not being able to find or load 
the editor.
I then read some of the bugs and believe this may have something to do with the 
new JRE 1.5.  It seems VE does not function with 1.5.
I then tried to look at an old project and I was unable to view a jave source 
file.  I tried to disable Visual editing through Help>Software Updates>Manage 
Configuration>  and now it is just messed up. Seems to go into an infinate loop 
when I try to open a java file.  Decided to try and disable GEf and EMF as well 
but this is not helping.   Unless there is a suggested fix I will  likely do a 
reinstall.
Thanks.
So warning for other users.  Don't try and run VE with the latest JRE and lates 
Eclipse.

Just discovered the ability to revert to a previous configuration.
This is an excellent feature.  
Eclipse is very cool.
Was able to revert to a previous configuration prior to installing VE and 
things are working again (without VE installed).

VE for the most part runs fine with a 1.5 JRE, but it isn't officially supported
yet.  The problems you ran into were probably caused by installing VE 1.0.* on
Eclipse 3.1*.  VE 1.0.* is only compatible with Eclipse 3.0.1 and greater.  To
run VE on Eclipse 3.1, you'll need to use a VE 1.1 milestone.  Check the
requirements section of the VE download page for the required versions.

Below is a post I put to a chat group.
I believe the error message has evolved as I try and hack and get this working. 
One of the errors I have encountered is in the message below.


Hello.

I have been using eclipse for a couple of months now and decided to explore
the VE plugin.
I have problems getting the VE plugin to work with 3.1.
I have it working with 3.0 but not 3.1.

Here's the background.  I originally started with 3.0.
It was unzipped into d:\eclipse.
I renamed it to d:\eclipse3p0
It worked fine.
I then wanted to run with the latest JRE and felt I needed ecliipse 3.1.
So unzipped 3.1 into d:\eclipse and renamed to d:\eclipse3p1.
I worked for a month with this and then decided to try and get the VE plugin
working.

Used the plugin manager to download all the latest and tried running VE and
encountered errors.
Decided to install the VE plugin into eclipse 3.0 and it works.

Then I started reading the posts on this and saw it is possible to run VE
with 3.1 but realized I didn't have the RC2 version.  I did try and install
Gef 3.1RC1, emf I200506091102, VE 1.1m2 with 3.1 but it had similar errors
as before.  Thus I figured I had to have 3.1RC2 or better.

I thought I'd give 3.1RC3 a try.  Should this work?
unzipped to Eclipse, unzipped the Gef 3.1RC1, emf I200506091102, VE 1.1m2
into the eclipse install directory.  Then did the update add new features
and installed lot of EMF and GEF plugins.

Here's the error.
An internal error occurred during: "Create Remote VM for Visual Editor for
Java".

Here's the beginning of the Error log.
I have not included the whole thing since each time I play the log gets
longer.

If still a problem, please reopen.
